info.detailed: I am a Front-End Angular Developer with experience in Back-End Development. I am currently working as a Front-End Developer while also teaching Front-End Development at

about.first_text: Hello, I am Konstantine Datunishvili, a Front-End Angular Developer. I have a passion for creating intuitive user interfaces via Angular.
about.second_text_second: since September 2021 and have previously worked on various projects and companies.
about.third_text: Also possess Back-End development knowledge and can build Full-Stack projects with Node & Angular. I strive to keep up with the latest trends in web development.
about.forth_text: Here are a few technologies I've been working with recently:

details.1: As a senior developer, I am responsible for maintaining an existing Angular project structured as a monorepo using Nx.
details.2: My duties include ensuring the current codebase is stable, efficient, and bug-free, while continuously refactoring and enhancing the code for better performance and readability.
details.3: I manage dependencies by keeping them up-to-date and ensuring compatibility and security.
details.4: In addition to these technical tasks, I implement new features as needed, ensuring they integrate seamlessly with the existing project.
details.5: Collaboration is a key part of my role, as I work closely with other developers, designers, and stakeholders to ensure smooth communication and integration.
details.6: Furthermore, I collaborate with designers using Figma to translate design specifications into high-quality, functional UI components.

details.1: As a Lecturer specializing in front-end development, I conduct live sessions for students on Microsoft Teams. All sessions are recorded for students to review at their convenience.
details.2: I cover topics such as HTML, CSS, SCSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, SweetAlert, Angular, Angular Material, and provide a brief introduction to RxJS.
details.3: I also assign and evaluate homework to reinforce learning and provide feedback.
details.4: My goal is to create an engaging learning environment and equip students with the skills needed for successful careers in front-end development.

details.1: I was developing and maintain frontend applications based on Angular.
details.2: Developed UI/UX features in Angular as described and displayed in the graphical design, ensure and advice on the technical feasibility of the UI/UX designs.
details.3: Optimize applications for scalability, cross-browser, cross-device and built reusable code for future use.
details.4: Work products were written in HTML5, SCSS and Angular.

details.1: I am an experienced Full-stack developer specializing in Angular for Front-end development and Node.js with Express and MongoDB for Back-end development.
details.2: With a proven track record of successfully delivering projects, I have worked on various assignments creating dynamic user interfaces and implementing efficient data storage solutions.

EverREST.title: EverREST
EverREST.description: EveREST was built to assist front-end developers in creating websites more efficiently. The concept revolves around providing free API calls achievable through a REST API. This project empowers users to employ CRUD operations at no cost. Users can develop shopping websites, implement cart functionalities, manage authentication, generate QR codes, retrieve random quotes, and much more.

iswavle.title: Iswavle
iswavle.description: This website provides free learning resources for Front End development. The website has a built-in code editor that allows you to write and experiment with code directly on the platform. You can practice with practical examples integrated into educational articles. The website is available only in the Georgian language.

qr_code.title: QR Code
qr_code.description: I have developed the scientific project titled 'Multi-level Access of Information Systems by QR Codes'. The idea has been successfully implemented and demonstrated through the example of a higher educational institution, specifically a university.

archive.subtitle: A list of things I've worked on, which are public, as well have some projects that aren't published or are private.
archive.title: Title

qr.title: Multi-level access to information systems by QR codes for wearable devices

role.title: My role in article
role.text_1: As a developer, I was responsible for maintaining and optimizing the code, and developing the app's frontend and backend functionality.

abstract.title: Abstract
abstract.text_1: Multi-level access of information systems by QR codes for wearable devices is a scientific project developed at Batumi State University. The project was implemented and tested in a university setting, but it has the potential to be used in a wide range of business and government organizations.
abstract.text_2: Researchers at Batumi State University developed a software product that allows people with different statuses to access different data using a single static QR code. The QR code can be placed on any object, and the data that is displayed will vary depending on the user's status. For example, in a university setting, employees and students could be given different access to information about classes, events, and resources.
abstract.text_3: The QR code assigned to a room remains unchanged even if the processes in the room change. This means that the QR code only needs to be updated once, even if the information about the room changes frequently. For example, if a classroom is used for different classes throughout the day, the QR code would not need to be updated each time.
abstract.text_4: The software product can be used to digitize cities, providing different information to users of different access levels. For example, tourists could use QR codes to access information about attractions, restaurants, and cafes. Customers could use QR codes to access information about loyalty programs and special offers.
abstract.text_5: The system is simple and technologically practical, with a wide range of potential applications. The researchers at Batumi State University used modern computer technology, Internet technologies, and programming tools to develop the software product.
